channel.title: Login problem
channel.description:
Hello All...
i have a little problem with ppl who want to log in ...
and with the Mopar's Status Checker
when i use my ip "example"scape.no-ip.lol (just an example)
i can log in with it
when ppl use the same IP it says that the server is ofline...
how come i can log in on that IP and they dont...?
(i have portforwarded and use NO-IP DUC)
Portforward pic
[IMG]http://i295.photobucket.com/albums/mm151/Stijn_/portforward.jpg[/img]

item.title: Login problem
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Stijn_Scape Owner Stijn Scape
item.description:
@Owner_Stijn_Scape wrote:

[quote=“djdoyle1, post:32, topic:244643”]ok i had this problem (port forwarding)
Download hamachi make YOUR OWN server thing
Then people can just connect to your hamachi server IP
just open up runserver.bat and then open your best client for hamachi (silab)
your done![/quote]

but then only ppl with hamachi can join right ?

Read full topic

item.title: Login problem
item.dc:creator: @djdoyle1 djdoyle1
item.description:
@djdoyle1 wrote:

ok i had this problem (port forwarding)
Download hamachi make YOUR OWN server thing
Then people can just connect to your hamachi server IP
just open up runserver.bat and then open your best client for hamachi (silab)
your done!

item.title: Login problem
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Stijn_Scape Owner Stijn Scape
item.description:
@Owner_Stijn_Scape wrote:

[quote=“Zev, post:30, topic:244643”]Start > control panel > windows firewall

Click on the exceptions tab then at the bottom click “add port”.

Any name will do. Type 43594 for the port. This is another way of portforwarding I found when I couldn’t use the internet browser to do it.

This may or may not help, good luck.[/quote]

i already have done that

Read full topic

item.title: Login problem
item.dc:creator: @Zev Zev
item.description:
@Zev wrote:

Start > control panel > windows firewall

Click on the exceptions tab then at the bottom click “add port”.

Any name will do. Type 43594 for the port. This is another way of portforwarding I found when I couldn’t use the internet browser to do it.

This may or may not help, good luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Login problem
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Stijn_Scape Owner Stijn Scape
item.description:
@Owner_Stijn_Scape wrote:

[quote=“chassy13, post:24, topic:244643”]Your IP is not 192.168.1.1

To get the last 3 digits, go into start > Settings > network connections > then click on the one connected > and when it opens click support > and it should say IP Adress: 192.168.1.###[/quote]

its 192.168.1.101 … do i need to put that in my portforward ?

Read full topic

item.title: Login problem
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Your IP is not 192.168.1.1

To get the last 3 digits, go into start > Settings > network connections > then click on the one connected > and when it opens click support > and it should say IP Adress: 192.168.1.###

item.title: Login problem
item.dc:creator: @p0sesed_s0ul p0sesed s0ul
item.description:
@p0sesed_s0ul wrote:

well your port forward is wrong because your router is 192.168.1.1 so another way to check YOUR ip is go into your router find DHCP client list click on that find your computer and check what ip you are then in your portforward where you have put 192.168.1.1 put it as the number given next to your computers name hope this helped

Read full topic

item.title: Login problem
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Stijn_Scape Owner Stijn Scape
item.description:
@Owner_Stijn_Scape wrote:

[quote=“roberini, post:20, topic:244643”][quote author=Owner Stijn Scape link=topic=321013.msg2539793#msg2539793 date=1226947146]

On your port forward, make sure you have the correct 192.168.2.()

start > Run > cmd > ipconfig > copy the last digit of the 192.168.2.()
make sure its the same.

when i do ipconfig on my cmd im getting an error … is there a other way to check how ?
[/quote]

give ipconfig /all a try, what is your error by the way? Make a prt scrn. If you have a dutch pc(which means your cmd is dutch) i don’t care because i’m dutch too. I can read it ;)[/quote]

here’s the error

Read full topic

give ipconfig /all a try, what is your error by the way? Make a prt scrn. If you have a dutch pc(which means your cmd is dutch) i don’t care because i’m dutch too. I can read it
